thread.title: Silver Spring Networks names new CEO as stock struggles

author: Angela Swartz
title: Silver Spring Networks names new CEO as stock struggles
text:
Courtesy Mike Bell, an Apple and Intel alum, is Silver Spring Networks' new CEO and president,… more Silver Spring Networks Inc. is saying goodbye to its longtime chief executive officer Scott Lang , as the company’s stock has fallen to around $11 a share, down from its $17 a share price the day it went public in 2013 . The smart grid technology company based out of Redwood City moved Lang to an executive chairman role while former Intel exec Mike Bell is the new CEO and president of the company. Lang was the company’s founding chief executive and was its president and CEO for 11 years. Subscribe to SVBJ's free morning email newsletter. http://www.bizjournals.com/sanjose/promo/sanjose-ampm Bell has more than 24 years experience in tech and most recently came from Intel where he was vice president, leading new devices, mobility and communications teams. Before that he held leadership roles at Apple Inc., — where he spent 16 years — and Palm Inc. The 13-year-old Silver Spring, which runs a hardware and software network that helps utility companies tap the “smart grid” to help lower costs and optimize energy use, is one of the 50 percent of Bay Area companies that had an IPO after 2013 that are now under water. Twitter Inc., Ooma Inc., and Rocket Fuel Inc., are some of those other companies, according to Renaissance Capital. Stock for Silver Spring Networks has slightly rebounded since January, when it hit a low of about $7. The company did take in $77.2 million in revenue in the quarter that ended on June 30 , up from $41.6 million the same time a year earlier. Silver Spring Networks has been trying to move beyond its hardware and software services into the Internet of Things, an area that Bell is familiar with from his work at Intel and Apple. Currently, the company has more than 21.5 million critical infrastructure devices connected across five continents. “As we accelerate our innovations for utilities, smart cities and additional emerging markets, Mike’s proven track record makes him ideally suited to lead Silver Spring in our next phase of growth,” Lang said in a press release.
